alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Sedgwick (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 10:41PM MDT until April 22 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Phillips County in northeastern Colorado... Eastern Sedgwick County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 1130 PM MDT. * At 1040 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Lewellen to 13 miles south of Pleasant Valley, or along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Oshkosh to 16 miles southeast of Holyoke, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Phillips and eastern Sedgwick Counties. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. Prepare immediately for damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
